attributes.action: Instigate a massive nuclear power plant construction programme
attributes.background: Through a well-constructed nuclear power plant programmed to run with free charging points nationally, we can reduce carbon output by 70% in 15 years. Government must just take action as soon as it can.
attributes.additional_details: Though the the real problem is greed and corruption, but the global warming is reaching a threatening level now as we all know! The debate about climate change mindfully plays into the assumption that CO2 produced by burning fossil fuels is causing the warming. That's true. And if we need to deal with that, we have to be timely. It is a safe, low cost solution to start using Nuclear power plants to prevent ten thou tons of nasty fission products from destroying our earth. Government must help.

attributes.action: Make more affordable homes for larger families more 3/4 bed homed needed!
attributes.background: More affordable homes needed for larger families, build more affordable homes. We lack 3 but mainly 4 bedroom properties, with the amount of housing developments going up why do the government not encourage larger properties for families on these developments?
attributes.additional_details: Crawley council have stated to Crawley news paper that they only manage 260 4 bedroom properies with the demand being a lot higher for growing families then they can accommodate for and I'm sure with growing population this is an on going problem, not just locally but nationwide.

attributes.action: Exclude Disabled Children families & Domestic Violence victims from Bedroom Tax
attributes.background: Accept the Court ruling that "bedroom" taxing families with disabled children and victims of domestic violence is discriminatory where the extra room is for overnight carers, disability equipment and approved panic rooms. The tax should be ammended & no taxpayer money used to appeal the decision.

attributes.action: Increase the availability of Gender Identity Clinics to under 17s
attributes.background: Transgender teenagers in the UK currently do not have access to Gender Identity Clinics. This is dangerous, unnecessary and causing transgender teens to commit suicide. We push the government to allow transgender teens to be allowed access to the Gender Identity Clinics
attributes.additional_details: Not only this, currently, the GICs in the NHS are severely underfunded. Many people start identifying as transgender whilst they are adolescent and require things like HRT and speech therapy to help with things like Gender Dysphoria. It is imperative to increase access to these clinics for young people.

attributes.action: Give all UK households the choice of free nuisance call blocking.
attributes.background: Many households throughout the UK are plagued by nuisance callers, whether they be PPI claims, accident claims or telephone surveys. The majority are from oversees who do not abide to the TPS code of practice. Currently residents in the UK have to pay for call blocking capabilities.
attributes.additional_details: Companies such as BT should not be able to cash in on nuisance calls and I am petitioning to give UK households the choice to have call blocking capabilities installed for free. Every UK resident should be able to relax in the comfort of their own home without being hounded by these UK and oversees call centres. As phone companies seem unable to protect us from this they should offer the blocking ability for free.

attributes.action: Plant more trees to reduce CO2 in the atmosphere
attributes.background: As time goes by, CO2 emissions are increasing and is having a negative impact on us which we WILL see in the future. To help with this problem, we must plant a significant amount of more trees than we currently do, to help remove CO2 from the atmosphere. We must also cut less trees if possible.
attributes.additional_details: By saying less, I am not saying no trees, but less if possible. If we go into the future the way we are know we are going to see some negative effects such as flooding. We must act now and sign this petition not ignore it, the government needs to see it!

attributes.action: All buses in the uk must legally be fitted with door safety equipment
attributes.background: Following an incident that could have caused serious injury or even death to one of my children due to a bus driver driving the bus with doors open, I move to have equipment legally required on buses that stops the bus from moving while doors are open.

attributes.action: Allow refugees that have been resettled in the UK to do paid work.
attributes.background: The UK government has started allowing additional refugees to live here which is great.  What's not so great is these people and families have to rely on support from the state.
attributes.additional_details: I think it would be more beneficial for these people to be allowed to do paid work in the UK, so they can contribute to our society and have more of a life here.

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Make Blue Badges Available to People With Mental Health Conditions.
attributes.background:
Under current regulations mental health conditions such as agoraphobia, anxiety and panic disorder are not accepted as valid reasons for needing a Blue Badge.
These conditions can be equally and sometimes more debilitating than a physical disability and it is discriminatory to exclude them.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badges, which allow people with certain disabilities to park closer to services, are only available to those with a physical disability. Those suffering from the above conditions are not able to apply for a badge unless they receive the higher rate of the mobility component of DLA.
The exception is if a person is unable to follow a familiar route without aid.
Mental health conditions can affect mobility and be extremely disabling, preventing a full life. Blue Badges could help with this.

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: All school meals in the UK to be planned and supervised by a nutritionist
attributes.background: Better nutrition for our kids needs to be a priority. Nutrition is the very foundation for a healthy life. Hungry kids tend not to pay attention during class, lack focus and affects their moods.
attributes.additional_details: Example, Finland one of the best education systems in the world, is nutrition part of their success? http://www.oph.fi/download/47657_school_meals_in_finland.pdf

attributes.action: UK Cities who voted "Remain" to be granted freedom to leave the UK & join the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum should never have happened.  The UK is a REPRESENTATIVE democracy ie we select and pay politicians to do the business of Government for us.  A decision so momentous should not have been handed to an electorate unqualified to comprehend the magnitude of the task.
attributes.additional_details:
The Referendum was about economics & trade. The media & certain politicians made it about blaming hard-working immigrants.

The EU Referendum was not supported by the educated or the young.  It was not supported by the cities.

London has a bigger GDP than many states. My city, Norwich, has thriving links with Europe as does Cambridge.  

We in the cities who voted to Remain in the EU see no alternative but to petition to be allowed to leave a country determined to commit economic suicide.

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: Social Services should have to voice record all meetings and visits.
attributes.background: Social services often try to put those who attend meetings with them off when it come to recording meetings. Their code of conduct explains they should be open and honest so I question why they will not do this. It would help to avoid disputes over what was said and ensure clarity for documentation
attributes.additional_details:
Social services documents are well known for being inaccurate and falsified. If you notify social services you wish to record all meetings they take extreme exception however if they were to note down events accurately surely this would just be another form of evidence.
Social services having to record means they cannot deny knowledge of events, or be accused of recording inaccurately as there will be evidence of what was said. It also can act as a form of reference to ensure reports reflect events.

attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: End all UK weapons sales to oppressive regimes.
attributes.background: The UK currently sells large quantities of weapons to countries that the Foreign Office recognises as having poor human rights records, including some that have even been accused of war crimes. Profit and political pandering to these regimes should not outweigh basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.amnesty.org.uk/yemen-conflict-uk-must-stop-selling-arms-saudi-arabia

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/britain-still-arming-israel-despite-fear-weapons-will-be-used-against-gaza-10357621.html

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/28/uk-weapons-sold-countries-poor-human-rights-saudi-arabia?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/08/killer-facts-the-scale-of-the-global-arms-trade/

attributes.action:
In, out, or Sort it out?

Add a change the EU option to the referendum ballot.
attributes.background: The in out EU referendum is not providing the British people with the choice the majority wish to make. Life is not black or white it is grey. By far the majority of voters would, given the choice send a message of protest to the EU demanding reform.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'stay' and 'leave' camps both identify what is wrong with Europe, neither provide a clear vision, or model or plan to optimise Britain's relationship with it.

There is an overwhelming majority for change. The EU needs to hear the clear voice of Btritain.

attributes.action: Reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber of devolved assemblies
attributes.background: To reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber for every devolved Parliament and Assembly in the United Kingdom to promote good governance while reducing the future burden on the taxpayers of the Realm with unnecessary duplication across the nation.

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: Tougher consequences for Domestic Abuse including mental and financial abuse.
attributes.background: Domestic Abuse is looked upon as mostly solely physical abuse in society, and this needs to change. It needs to be made publicly aware that it's more than just physical, including mental and financial. This can impact a victims life as much as phsyical, and should hold a higher sentence for all.
attributes.additional_details: There should be higher consequences for all aspects of domestic abuse including an automatic 2 year restraining order for anyone found guilty of causing Domestic abuse. This will resolve further issues including harassment and stalking preventing further abuse. A domestic Abuse list should be created to protect victims who suffered the abuse. Mental and financial abuse should be thoroughly investigated having the same consequences as phsyical. These consequences should prevent abuse re-occuring

attributes.action: Veto Turkey's entry into the EU.
attributes.background: Recep Erdoğan's Turkey is a nation of deteriorating rights and authoritarian state harassment. Its GDP is half the EU average. It borders two war-zones. It uses the migrant crisis as blackmail and aggressively seeks prosecution for defamation outside of its borders. NO to Turkey's EU membership.
attributes.additional_details:
FREEDOM HOUSE: https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2016/turkey

AMNESTY: https://www.amnesty.org/en/countries/europe-and-central-asia/turkey/

HUMAN RIGHTS WATCH: https://www.hrw.org/europe/central-asia/turkey

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Give 100% tax relief on pensions when care home costs exceed the pension income.
attributes.background: My elderly mother-in-law has Alzheimers Dementia and lives in a care home. Total pension income is around £16K PA.  Total care home costs are £33K and rising.  Why is it necessary to pay several thousand pounds income tax which erodes the reserves faster and will lead to her needing government help?
attributes.additional_details: There was a plan to cap the care costs but that has now been scrapped.  In any case it was not a true and honest capping but a sneaky way to make political capital out of addressing care costs without actually spending any money.  It would have benefited only a tiny minority. To allow large corporates to pay paltry amounts of tax whilst levying income tax on pensions paid to paupers is morally and ethically wrong and we should address this totally unjust state of affairs.

attributes.action: Change to (CCRs) Regulations 2013 to an prevent online fraud
attributes.background: There is loop hole being exploited by a small number of online buyers, where if the seller cannot prove delivery (ie sent WITHOUT ONLINE TRACKING) the buyer claims non-delivery getting money back and the goods (theft). This is costing traders a small fortune in claims.
attributes.additional_details: What I propose is if the seller offers a tracking service and the buyer declines that service, then the risk should pass from the seller to the buyer (PROVIDING THE SELLER CAN PROVE DISPATCH. ie Royal Mail Certificate of posting) and no claims will be accepted for non-delivery. This will make no difference for goods damaged in transit claims.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn Bridge tolls.
attributes.background: The government recently announced a cut to the Severn Bridge tolls after the bridges revert to public ownership in 2017.  This is not enough. This tax on trade and the local community should be removed particularly in light of the struggling economies of South Wales and the Forest of Dean.

attributes.action: Give the UK a Dutch style referendum vote on the Ukraine joining the EU.
attributes.background: The Dutch people have just been robbed by the EU officials, by having a 64% vote against the Ukraine joining, being completely ignored. Brussels have said that the Ukraine deserve to join as they have met their targets and so the Dutch people are incorrect in thier view and opinion.

attributes.action: Make people who are Specials not have to complete a CKP to join as a constable.
attributes.background:
Specials work as police officers for free.

However to join and get a fulltime job we have to spend £750+ on a course that teaches us everything we already know.

If specials have been doing the role, Do we really need to do an entry level course to teach us the basic knowledge of policing
attributes.additional_details:
The collage of policing charge huge amounts of money for the course, which doesnt even gaurentee you a job. 

Specials are already trusted by the force to go out on their own and do they job, so why do they have to pay for a course when they already know it all?

attributes.action: Strip First Group as franchise holders of Great Western Railways
attributes.background: General contempt for passengers' needs and woeful strategy in times of difficulty. Relaxed attitude to cancellations and delays.  Timetable relaxation to suit GWR.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times from Wiltshire are broadly 20% longer and tickets broadly 80% dearer than just over a decade ago.  Car park costs doubled.  Cancellations and delays are frequent. Limited conpensation for season ticket holders and GWR are past masters at making it difficult to claim. General contempt for the people they are supposed to serve.

attributes.action: I want every Cancer Survivor to be given a Long Term comprehensive Care Package
attributes.background: Failure to manage Consequences of Cancer Treatment effectively, long term, compromises survival, quality of life, recovery and patient experience. In addition the economy is impacted, through people being unable to return to work or education.  Mental Health is not being addressed
attributes.additional_details: Statistics show 1 in 2 of us will get a Cancer diagnosis, and at least 500,000 people in the UK are facing poor health or disability after treatment for cancer – that’s 25% of people who have already had a cancer diagnosis. Commissioners discriminate because complex needs include co-morbidities which are not recognised by the Private Service Providers.   The National Health Service was created to ensure no one slipped through the net and received joined up Care from Cradle to Grave.

attributes.action: Re-introduce Capital Punishment for Terrorism
attributes.background: Since the attack on America on 9/11 2002 when some 3,000 innocent people were murdered there have been at least another 2,000 men, women and children cowardly murdered in addition to those murdered in Belgium today.
attributes.additional_details:
Enough is enough!

Tomorrow it could be you or I or your children or loved ones.

These cowards think that we are weak because we do nothing and whilst ever they believe this they will carry on slaughtering us.

By doing nothing we are in danger of losing the Freedom bought for us at such great cost twice in the last Century.  We must not betray the Sacrifice of those brave men and women who gave their lives for us to live in Freedom.

Those who bring, or would bring, death and destruction into our Homelands should also forfeit their lives in order to save innocent lives and we therefore humbly petition our Members of Parliament to re-introduce the death penalty for anyone found guilty of terrorist offences

attributes.action: Cap car insurance at a max of £700 for young/first drivers for cars upto 130bhp.
attributes.background: For many young drivers (who are mainly students) cannot afford silly prices insurance companies ask for. We do not deserve to pay thousands after being profiled. A max price should of £700 be set on cars upto 130bhp in order to prove to insurers that not all young drivers deserve to pay thousands.
attributes.additional_details: I myself a long with many others have been given quotes on e.g 1.0 cars upto £10,000! Even paying £2000 is alot in any case and I know people who have been paying that much with telemetry boxes fitted also. A Base price should be set.

attributes.action: stop ALL benefit cuts.
attributes.background:
the government is again planning to cut benefits... across the board. this is wrong. these benefits are needed to survive. too many are being forced to use food banks.
the government is pushing thousands into poverty. and most are already there. vote to stop this.  take action.

attributes.action: Implement a Fibroids Education Awareness and Screening Program
attributes.background: NHS statistics state 1 in 3 women from menstrual to menopausal age may have fibroids, which are non-cancerous growths in the womb. Women become aware of fibroids when experiencing extreme pain, heavy bleeding, infertility etc. A high oestrogen diet could contribute to fibroid growth.
attributes.additional_details:
References 
Fibroids - http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Fibroids/Pages/Introduction.aspx

Fibroids symptoms and diet - http://www.smartnutrition.co.uk/conditions/female-health/fibroids/

attributes.action: Create a framework for PSHE in KS4
attributes.background: Presently, PSHE is a compulsory but non-statutory subject, meaning that although  it has to be taught, it is fully flexible with the content of which is taught. Having now left school, and be in an environment that is completely different I feel very unprepared for a variety of situations.
attributes.additional_details: The Governments guidance to delivering PSHE instructs teachers to tailor lessons to 'suit the needs of pupils', which seems to ignore the diversity of students and that once they have left school they may face different types of problems. The diversity of sexual orientations in sexual education is often ignored, what to do in an area with high crime rates, how to get a loan or mortgage or how to be a parent should you become a young parent. These are just a few things that need to be improved.

attributes.action: Tax "junk foods", & give the money to Companies who produce healthy products.
attributes.background: What we eat has a detrimental affect on our physical and mental health & the wrong decisions are costing the NHS money. People need incentive to eat a balanced diet & the price difference isn't helping.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC news reported that Poor diet 'costs NHS £6bn a year'
Jamie oliver saw an increase in grades and a reduction "authorised absences" — which are generally due to illness – fell by 15% after his 2004 Feed Me Better campaign,
Researchers describe one survey which found that 39% of people rated price as the most important factor in their food choice compared to just 9% who considered a food’s healthiness to be most important. Thursday October 9 2014, NHS choices.

attributes.action: Ban loud vehicle exhaust modification
attributes.background: Ban people modifying their cars and bikes to have louder exhausts than the ones they come with. There is no reason what so ever for these people to have loud exhausts apart from misguided vanity, yet the general public have to put up with their right to peace and quiet being removed by a few idiots.
attributes.additional_details: I live and work in central Elgin and have to listen to the same cars tearing round and round the town centre over and over again day and night. Ban this pointless modification culture now, as I'm sure it will only get worse. It is unfair and there is no need for them to be doing this. It is anti-social behaviour and a nuisance.

attributes.action: We need more military personnel at least 500K to give use the security we need.
attributes.background: The UK has a strong but small army, we achieve many goals like defeating terrorist groups but with an army the size of just under 200,000 its hard to achieve all our goals. The recent issues of immigrants coming into the country just proves how much our border's are not protected completely.
attributes.additional_details:
This link shows our armed forces amount in the RAF, NAVY and ARMY, take a look you might be surprised.

http://www.globalfirepower.com/country-military-strength-detail.asp?country_id=united-kingdom

Many smaller countries have armies much bigger then ours and that says something. All the hard work of the British empire has been forgotten.

attributes.action: The NHS MUST stop giving free treatment to immigrants immediately!
attributes.background: The UK is constantly taking in immigrants from other countries, however we CANNOT afford to pay for so much people for their treatment. At this rate, if the NHS does continue to pay for their treatment, the NHS will start to collapse. We must only give free treatment to our British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: If we continue to provide free health care to Non British people (and there is loads of them) then we will come to the point where we cannot even help ourselves. Lets get this to 100,000 signatures, so MPs can debate a such important issue. The government seriously needs to stop it, we CANNOT afford it.

attributes.action: Put up the age for learner drivers from 17 to  21.
attributes.background: Stop learner drivers applying for lessons at the age of 17 to 21 has there are more accedents with youngsters these days with boy racing and drink driving and 17 years of age you are only still a child.

attributes.action: Review Child Tax Credits to stop people being overpaid.
attributes.background: Many parents have received the "dreaded" letter from the child tax credit office telling us that we have (unknowingly) been overpaid child tax credits and now face having to pay back a huge amount of money or will be taken to court. This is due to a very complicated application and benefits system.
attributes.additional_details: Figures are based on estimated earnings and estimated child care costs for the year. Forms do not ask the right questions with regards to other schemes and benefits misleading parents and allowing them to be claiming for other benefits which they do not realise they are not entitled to. A number of complicated forms are sent out to "check" details throughout the year very often with wrong information on. Errors are amended by lengthy phone calls to the credit office, but still we get it wrong!

attributes.action: Put Pressure on the Airlines to Lower Ticket Prices due to Lower Fuel prices.
attributes.background: With the Large drop in Prices at the Pumps Airlines have Not Followed with Reductions in Ticket Prices, so they must be making Very large Profits from their Passengers which is wrong, should be an Equal Playing Field.
attributes.additional_details:
Air Travel have Not come down although Fuel have by a Large amount, this is Ripping Off their Customers.

Let's get the Government to put pressure on Airlines to bring their prices down by way of Cheaper Fares.

attributes.action: Remove the time restrictions on bus passes for disabled people.
attributes.background:
Currently the English National Concessionary Travel Scheme grants free bus travel via a special bus pass for both elderly people and eligible disabled people.

Free travel is limited to between 9:30am and 11pm on weekdays, but is at any time at weekends and public holidays.
attributes.additional_details:
Many disabled people face obstacles to working, due directly to their disabilities. This limits the range of jobs they can even consider doing.

Some people who are disabled face additional obstacles to working because they're prohibited from driving. They may have to take lower paid jobs closer to home, or only work part time.

Allowing disabled people to travel on buses for free at any time would help disabled people to work, by encouraging them to travel further to work.

attributes.action: Make it easier for small and medium-sized businesses to supply government.
attributes.background: I own a small business and am encouraged to hear government talk of making things easier for small & medium-sized businesses (SMEs) to supply government yet find no evidence this is happening.
attributes.additional_details:
When I see tender documents running into several hundred pages I seriously doubt a drive from government to widen up the supply chain to SMEs as the resources are simply not available.

Add to this the increasing burden of health & safety legislation, compulsory employment surveys, automatic enrolment pensions, four annual tax returns etc etc and we are drowning in a sea of petty admin, struggling to focus on running our business.

attributes.action: Provide substainable funding our Youth and Community Centres
attributes.background: Local Youth and community centres that act as main social gathering for a wide range of people from the elderly, youth and disabled where some of the support and guidance they need are now being cut viscously.
attributes.additional_details: One in four of England’s youth services face catastrophic cuts of between 21-30 per cent – three times higher than the general level of council cuts. Many authorities intend to get rid of their youth services completely, while 80% of voluntary organisations providing services for young people have said programmes will be cut. Local authority chiefs predict that youth service budgets will be slashed by £100 million, leading to the loss of 3,000 full-time youth worker jobs.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use benefit tests as a short cut for UNRELATED provision
attributes.background: Receipt of benefits is used as a test for providing other services. This is acceptable only if the tests have *substantial* overlap with the concession. The law should require independent criteria where there is not *substantial* overlap so concessions go to the appropriate people
attributes.additional_details:
EG: Receipt of DLA or PIP Mobility is an appropriate "short cut" for decisions on the distance someone can walk as the benefit is itself a measure of walking distance

Receipt of DLA/PIP Care/Daily Living is a inappropriate test of a person's need for concessionary bus travel for a companion to push a wheelchair or carry shopping, as the benefit tests only the help required with cooking, bathing, dressing and toileting, not pushing a wheelchair. It explicitly bans including help with shopping.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for dogs to have micro trackers to stop dog theft!
attributes.background: Everyday hundreds I dogs are going missing, wether they have been spooked and run off or being taken ! Dog theft isn't looked into as much, more could be done to stop theives from taking our beloved dogs.
attributes.additional_details: Everyday on social media networks missing or stolen dog posts are being uploaded by the minute, hundreds of dogs are out their without their owners! Troya was just a family dog that was well trained and loved by her owners. Christmas Eve she was stolen without any sightings or information. Today troya was found bound in a canal with a bag around her head and washing line round her neck with her paws bound together. God knows what she went through before she was found MURDERED!

attributes.action: Reduce road tax on cars that do less than 2000 miles a year!
attributes.background: For all those with a weekend toy that rarely sees daylight, that is only driven on sunny days, comes out of the garage for the odd car show and covers a total of 2000 miles a year or less.  When its MOT'd each year the mileage would be logged on the DVLA system to prove its less than 2000.
